Ok, If I understood Him correctly, David says: it's "just a little Ink 
Pen=
."  Some of the others say,  "penny," Penny, could have been  the name of a=
 
girl, if that's the case a fella called her name three times, "dog whistl=
e," 
a little kid says, "ice cream" not sure if this is correct, it could b=
e a 
game,  "bridge" maybe, the guy fell off a bridge to his  death or some=
thing, 
"kleenix" "brush" or "hair broom!" The guy saying "hair broom" coul=
d  have 
lived in the olden days.  They are funny sometimes,  attached is a=
 Skype file 
of David saying, "ink pen." maybe, i can get Him to say  it ov=
er the RS, He 
is tired right now, had a busy day as usual. sf 
 
 
 
In a =
message dated 7/16/2010 4:56:15 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
rasterer@yaho=
o.com writes:
 
 
 
 
It's not really a game: there are no winners or  lose=
rs.
It's just so we can experiment, try new methods, and see what  works, a=
nd 
learn.
I enjoyed your help in the last experiment, and I  hope you will=
 continue 
to contribute!

--- On Fri, 7/16/10,  SnowfireL@...,<Snowfir=

 Re:  [EVP-ITC] Experiment 2

Date:  Friday, Jul=
y 16, 2010, 12:48 PM


 
David doesn't want to play your game, maybe, i can=
 bug Him a bit  but, I 
don't think He wants to play this game anymore. sf
=
 
 
In a message dated 7/16/2010 3:42:38 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
rast=
erer@yahoo. com writes:

 
I am  hesitant to reveal the answer to  anyone b=
efore the end of the test, 
since that would call into  question a possible=
 'leak'.  

But I have loaded a  mac version of the file up now, which does=
n't use any  
self-extracting extra applications: just the disk imaging  bu=
ilt into the 
OS.  I'll look into doing the same with  Windows, so there is=
 no worry about 
any apps in the zip  file.



--- On Fri, 7/16/10, David K=
oenig  <floridajakeblues@ gmail.com> wrote:


From:  David Koenig <floridaj=
akeblues@ gmail.com>
Subject:  Re: [EVP-ITC] Experiment 2
To: EVP-ITC@yahoo=
groups  .com
Date: Friday, July 16, 2010, 12:15 PM


 
This is AWESOME!!!! =

We did several experiments like this on the Magic Cafe  and the results 
w=
ere amazing. However, I would request that  you contact one member on the 
=
board and tell them the real  answer. If the zip file carries any applicati=
ons 
it can not  be trusted unfortunately.
I think this can be very excitin=
g and fun too!!!!
Dave
THE MAN THE SKEPTICS REFUSED TO TEST FOR A MILLION  =
DOLLARS.

On Fri, Jul 16, 2010 at 2:28 PM,  rasterer <rasterer@yahoo. com> =
wrote:

 
 
 
 
Experiment 2

On Friday, 7/16/2010 I placed an  object on t=
op of my computer monitor, 
right in front of  me, and will leave it there =
until noon Denver time on  
Monday, 7/19/2010. This experiment asks for par=
ticipants  to determine what that 
object is. Vague or partial answers  won=
't be counted (for example, just 
giving a color, shape,  size, what it's m=
ade of, etc): we're looking for what 
it  is. Answers anyone reveals after =
noon Monday won't count.  Participants 
can use their ghost boxes, EVP reco=
rders, or  any other means they chose. At 
the end of the experiment,  I wi=
ll reveal the object, and a tally of the 
number of  correct and/or incorre=
ct answers.

In order to keep  me honest, I have taken a picture of the obj=
ect at the  
start of the experiment and loaded it to the Files section  (R=
J folder) of 
this group. The idea with this file is that  you can download=
 it now and 'keep 
it safe' on your  computer. Then at the end of the exper=
iment, I will post  
the password so you can reveal the contents of the fil=
e.  That way, you 
were in control of the original image during  the entire=
 test, not me. If you 
can follow the link, it is  here:

Windows users: _h=
ttp://tech. groups.yahoo.  com/group/ EVP-ITC/files/ 
RJ/RJ20100716.  win.z=
ip_ 
(http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ20100716.win.zi=
p) 

Mac users: _http://tech. groups.yahoo.  com/group/ EVP-ITC/files/ 
RJ/=
RJ20100716.  mac.zip_ 
(http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ=
/RJ20100716.mac.zip) 

And if you do not care to download the  zip file now=
, I will post the final 
image there at the end  of the experiment anyway.
=

My monitor is one of the  older box-like SONY CRTs, and says "Trinitron" 
=
and  "Multiscan 200sf" on the upper front. I have a couple  monitors stacke=
d 
in my closet too: they are not the  monitors used in this experiment (an=
d 
have nothing else on  them anyway), and I have several laptops around: t=
hey are 
 also not the monitors in this experiment. The monitor in  this ex=
periment 
is the only SONY monitor I have, says  "SONY in various places on=
 it, can be 
seen in the  following link from the first experiment, when th=
e correct  
answer would have been "radio":

_http://tech. groups.yahoo.  c=
om/group/ EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ.20100710.  
1.JPG_ (http://tech.groups.yahoo=
.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ.20100710.1.JPG) 

Please post all answers to=
 the group  thread: that way, there will be a 
public record and I  won't g=
et accused of losing any answers. 

And best  of luck to all the participan=
ts!

























--part1_71f71.28d61161.39729e58_alt_boundary
